item.name: Voodoo Weaver's Tools
entries: This set of {@item weaver's tools} is specialized for the crafting of effigiesâ€”small handcrafted dolls that can be crafted to represent a person or creature. While attuned to this item, you gain proficiency in {@item weaver's tools} and can use this item as a spellcasting focus whether you are holding the kit or one of your effigies.

entries.name: Sympathetic Magic
entries: You can create any number of effigies as part of a long rest. At any given time, you can have created a number of effigies equal to your proficiency bonus. If you create any more, they are replaced, beginning to disappear from oldest to newest. An effigy must later be linked to an individual creature through the creation of a taglock. The effigy itself is not magical, but its taglock is.

entries.name: Imitation
entries: As an action, you may attempt to create a taglock that will bind an effigy to a creature. This can be done so long as you possess a substantial piece of that creature, such as a lock of the creature's hair, their fingernails, blood, or a scrap of clothing, all of which are consumed whether or not you succeed. The chosen creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the taglock is succesfully created, binding that creature to an effigy. If the effigy is already bound to a creature, its binding is replaced. On a successful save, nothing happens, and you cannot attempt to bind that creature again for the next 24 hours. A willing creature can choose to fail this save. A {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell ends this effect, destroying the taglock.

Once given a taglock, an effigy magically changes its appearance to a basic representation of the creature it is bound to, taking on its general shape and colors even if they are not previously known to you.

entries.name: Correspondence
entries: If the creature bound to an effigy you are holding is within 60 feet of you, whenever you cast a spell with a range of touch, you may instead cast it on your effigy (even if it requires you to target a creature). When you do so, the spell instead targets the bound creature, ignoring any of the spell's usual restrictions on range and sight.

sizeEntry.name: Size:
entries: Medium (humanoid or hybrid form), Small (beast form)

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries: You may switch between 3 forms (humanoid, beast, hybrid) twice per long rest. Your beast form is considered your true form. Your creature type remains Fey in all forms.

items.name: Beast Form
entries: Your size becomes Small. You retain your personality, memories, and ability to speak.
You are able to understand and speak to animals of the same species.
Your movement speed, STR, DEX, AC, and attacks are determined by your Bestial Lineage.
You can't use or benefit from any equipment or class features.
You can't cast or concentrate on spells unless your lineage states otherwise.

items.name: Hybrid Form
entries: Your size is Medium. You become a humanoid with distinct beastlike features.
You are able to understand and speak to animals of the same species.
You are unable to wear heavy armor unless your lineage states otherwise.

items.name: Humanoid Form
entries: Your size is Medium. You assume the appearance of a humanoid race of your choice.
You may decide the form's appearance, but do not gain its languages or racial traits.

entries.name: Bestial Lineage
entries: Your heritage determines which abilities you gain by shapeshifting. Choose a lineage from the Bestial Lineages table. You gain the level 1 benefit of that lineage.

When you reach character levels 3 and 5, you learn a higher-level spell, as shown on the table. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select the lineage).

entries.caption: Bestial Lineages
rows: 2 STR, 16 DEX, 13 AC, walk 30 ft, burrow 5 ft. Melee 1d4 piercing
You can cast cantrips while in beast form. You know the {@spell Dancing Lights|XPHB} cantrip.
1 STR, 17 DEX, 15 AC, walk 20 ft, burrow 5 ft. Can't attack.
While in beast or hybrid form, you may Disengage as a bonus action. You also know the {@spell Starry Wisp|XPHB} cantrip.
15 STR, 14 DEX, 12 AC, walk 30 ft, climb 30 ft. Ranged 1d6 bludgeoning.
While in hybrid form, you gain a climb speed equal to your walk speed. You also know the {@spell Vicious Mockery|XPHB} cantrip.
4 STR, 15 DEX, 13 AC, walk 30 ft, climb 30 ft. Melee 1d4 piercing.
While in beast or hybrid form you may Hide as a bonus action. You also know the {@spell Elementalism|XPHB} cantrip.
10 STR, 11 DEX, 11 AC. Walk 20 ft, burrow 5 ft. Melee 1d8 slashing.
While in hybrid form, you may wear heavy armor, which does not give disadvantage on your Stealth checks. You also know the {@spell True Strike|XPHB} cantrip.
